2.text: Cut the aubergine however your recipe dictates.

3.text: Salt the exposed flesh of the aubergine.

4.text: Rinse the aubergine under water to remove the salt and thoroughly dry it.

6.text: Peel the aubergine, if desired, and cut to size.

7.text: Roast the aubergine about 20 minutes or until tender.

8.text: Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.

9.text: Slice the aubergine and brush with olive oil on both sides.

10.text: Add the aubergine slices to the hot oil.

11.text: When the slices are evenly browned, take them off the heat.

12.text: If you’re using a gas grill, preheat it.

13.text: Peel the aubergine, if desired, and cut into 1/2-inch slices.

14.text: Season as desired with herbs, salt, and ground black pepper.

15.text: Line the grill with foil or place it directly onto the rack.

16.text: Grill for about 8 minutes or until crispy and tender, turning occasionally.
